name: Ext.fx.Anim
doc:
This class manages animation for a specific target. The animation allows animation of various properties on the target, such as size, position, color and others.

Starting Conditions

The starting conditions for the animation are provided by the from configuration. Any/all of the properties in the from configuration can be specified. If a particular property is not defined, the starting value for that property will be read directly from the target.

End Conditions

The ending conditions for the animation are provided by the to configuration. These mark the final values once the animations has finished. The values in the from can mirror those in the to configuration to provide a starting point.

Other Options

  • duration: Specifies the time period of the animation.
  • easing: Specifies the easing of the animation.
  • iterations: Allows the animation to repeat a number of times.
  • alternate: Used in conjunction with iterations, reverses the direction every second iteration.

Example Code

var myComponent = Ext.create('Ext.Component', {
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 200,
    height: 200,
    style: 'border: 1px solid red;'
});

Ext.create('Ext.fx.Anim', {
    target: myComponent,
    duration: 1000,
    from: {
        width: 400 //starting width 400
    },
    to: {
        width: 300, //end width 300
        height: 300 // end height 300
    }
});

members.name: alternate
members.doc: Used in conjunction with iterations to reverse the animation each time an iteration completes.
members.short_doc: Used in conjunction with iterations to reverse the animation each time an iteration completes. ...

members.name: autoEnd
members.doc: true to immediately force this animation to its final state. This can be useful in cases where you want the final effect of an animation, but need to the actual animation dynamically. Also see the jumpToEnd method.
members.short_doc: true to immediately force this animation to its final state. ...

members.name: callback
members.doc: A function to be run after the animation has completed. @declarativeHandler
members.short_doc: A function to be run after the animation has completed. ...

members.name: delay
members.doc: Time to delay before starting the animation.
members.short_doc: Time to delay before starting the animation. ...

members.name: duration
members.doc: Time in milliseconds for a single animation to last. If the iterations property is specified, then each animate will take the same duration for each iteration.
members.short_doc: Time in milliseconds for a single animation to last. ...

members.name: dynamic
members.doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation.
members.short_doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. ...

members.name: easing
members.doc:
This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

  • backIn
  • backOut
  • bounceIn
  • bounceOut
  • ease
  • easeIn
  • easeOut
  • easeInOut
  • elasticIn
  • elasticOut
  • cubic-bezier(x1, y1, x2, y2)

Note that cubic-bezier will create a custom easing curve following the CSS3 transition-timing-function specification. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1] or the definition is invalid.
members.short_doc: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. ...

members.name: from
members.doc:
An object containing property/value pairs for the beginning of the animation. If not specified, the current state of the Ext.fx.target will be used. For example:

from: {
    opacity: 0,       // Transparent
    color: '#ffffff', // White
    left: 0
}
members.short_doc: An object containing property/value pairs for the beginning of the animation. ...

members.name: iterations
members.doc: Number of times to execute the animation.
members.short_doc: Number of times to execute the animation. ...

members.name: keyframes
members.doc:
Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern. 'from' is always considered '0%' and 'to' is considered '100%'. Every keyframe declaration must have a keyframe rule for 0% and 100%, possibly defined using "from" or "to". A keyframe declaration without these keyframe selectors is invalid and will not be available for animation. The keyframe declaration for a keyframe rule consists of properties and values. Properties that are unable to be animated are ignored in these rules, with the exception of 'easing' which can be changed at each keyframe. For example:

keyframes : {
    '0%': {
        left: 100
    },
    '40%': {
        left: 150
    },
    '60%': {
        left: 75
    },
    '100%': {
        left: 100
    }
}
members.short_doc: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern. ...

members.name: remove
members.doc: true to remove the target when the animation is complete, using the appropriate removal method for the target. For example, a component will be destroyed, elements will be removed.
members.short_doc:
true to remove the target when the animation is complete, using the appropriate removal
method for the target. ...

members.name: reverse
members.doc: Run the animation from the end to the beginning Defaults to false.
members.short_doc:
Run the animation from the end to the beginning
Defaults to false. ...

members.name: scope
members.doc: The scope that the callback function will be called with

members.name: target
members.doc: The Ext.fx.target.Target to apply the animation to. This should only be specified when creating an Ext.fx.Anim directly. The target does not need to be a Ext.fx.target.Target instance, it can be the underlying object. For example, you can pass a Component, Element or Sprite as the target and the Anim will create the appropriate Ext.fx.target.Target object automatically.
members.short_doc: The Ext.fx.target.Target to apply the animation to. ...

members.name: to
members.doc:
An object containing property/value pairs for the end of the animation. For example:

to: {
    opacity: 1,       // Opaque
    color: '#00ff00', // Green
    left: 500
}
members.short_doc: An object containing property/value pairs for the end of the animation. ...

members.name: bezierRE
currentIteration
members.doc: Current iteration the animation is running.
members.short_doc: Current iteration the animation is running. ...

members.name: damper
delayStart
members.doc: used to track a delayed starting time
members.short_doc: used to track a delayed starting time ...

members.name: endWasCalled
frameCount
isAnimation
members.doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Anim, or subclass thereof.
members.short_doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Anim, or subclass thereof. ...

members.name: paused
members.doc: Flag to determine if the animation is paused. Only set this to true if you need to keep the Anim instance around to be un-paused later; otherwise call end.
members.short_doc: Flag to determine if the animation is paused. ...

members.name: propHandlers
members.doc: Contains a cache of the interpolators to be used.

members.name: running
members.doc: Flag to determine if the animation has started
members.short_doc: Flag to determine if the animation has started ...

members.name: startTime
members.doc: Starting time of the animation.
members.short_doc: Starting time of the animation. ...

members.name: constructor
end
members.doc: Fire afteranimate event and end the animation. Usually called automatically when the animation reaches its final frame, but can also be called manually to preemptively stop and destroy the running animation.
members.short_doc: Fire afteranimate event and end the animation. ...

members.name: initAttrs
members.doc: Set up the initial currentAttrs hash.
members.short_doc: Set up the initial currentAttrs hash. ...

members.name: isReady
isRunning
jumpToEnd
members.doc: Immediately force this animation to its final state.
members.short_doc: Immediately force this animation to its final state. ...

members.doc: Perform lastFrame cleanup and handle iterations
members.short_doc: Perform lastFrame cleanup and handle iterations ...

members.name: runAnim
members.doc: Calculate attribute value at the passed timestamp.
members.short_doc: Calculate attribute value at the passed timestamp. ...

members.name: setAttr
members.doc: Helper to the target
members.short_doc: Helper to the target ...

members.name: start
members.doc: Fires beforeanimate and sets the running flag.
members.short_doc: Fires beforeanimate and sets the running flag. ...

members.name: afteranimate
members.doc: Fires when the animation is complete.
members.short_doc: Fires when the animation is complete. ...

members.name: beforeanimate
members.doc: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.
members.short_doc: Fires before the animation starts. ...

members.name: lastframe
members.doc: Fires when the animation's last frame has been set.
members.short_doc: Fires when the animation's last frame has been set. ...

short_doc: This class manages animation for a specific target. ...
